inspire.quote: We all know that light travels faster than sound. That’s why certain people appear bright until you hear them speak
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: To punish me for my contempt for authority, fate made me an authority myself
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: A perfection of means, and confusion of aims, seems to be our main problem
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Mankind invented the atomic bomb, but no mouse would ever construct a mousetrap
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Stay away from negative people. They have a problem for every solution
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Man usually avoids attributing cleverness to somebody else, unless it is an enemy
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Sometimes one pays most for the things one gets for nothing
inspire.author: Albert Einstein
Albert Einstein
inspire.quote: At our age, the devil doesn’t give you much time off!
Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Not everything that counts can be counted, and not everything that can be counted counts (Sign hanging in Einstein’s office at Princeton)
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: All of one’s contemporaries and aging friends are living in a delicate balance, and one feels that one’s own consciousness is no longer as brightly lit as it once was. But then, twilight with its more subdued colors has its charms as well
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: A clever person solves a problem. A wise person avoids it
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I soon learned to scent out what was able to lead to fundamentals and to turn aside from everything else, from the multitude of things that clutter up the mind
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: It would be possible to describe everything scientifically, but it would make no sense; it would be without meaning, as if you described a Beethoven symphony as a variation of wave pressure
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: No amount of experimentation can ever prove me right; a single experiment can prove me wrong
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: A new idea comes suddenly and in a rather intuitive way, but intuition is nothing but the outcome of earlier intellectual experience
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: As far as the laws of mathematics refer to reality, they are not certain, as far as they are certain, they do not refer to reality
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The foundation of morality should not be made dependent on myth nor tied to any authority lest doubt about the myth or about the legitimacy of the authority imperil the foundation of sound judgment and action
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The eternal mystery of the universe is its comprehensibility
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The intuitive mind is a sacred gift and the rational mind is a faithful servant. We have created a society that honors the servant and has forgotten the gift
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Education is what remains after one has forgotten everything he learned in school
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age 18
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: What is right is not always popular and what is popular is not always right
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: One lives one’s life under constant tension, until it is time to go for good
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I have remained a simple fellow who asks nothing of the world; only my youth is gone – the enchanting youth that forever walks on air
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I no longer need to take part in the competition of the big brains. Participating [in the process] has always seem to me an awful type of slavery no less evil than the passion for money or power
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I believe that a simple and unassuming manner of life is best for everyone, best both for the body and the mind
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Compassionate people are geniuses in the art of living, more necessary to the dignity, security, and joy of humanity than the discoverers of knowledge
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: A hundred times every day I remind myself that my inner and outer life depend on the labours of other men, living and dead, and that I must exert myself in order to give in the same measure as I received and am still receiving
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The fear of death is the most unjustified of all fears, for there’s no risk of accident for someone who’s dead
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I have firmly resolved to bite the dust, when my time comes, with a minimum of medical assistance, and up to then I will sin to my wicked heart’s content
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The old who have died live on in the young ones. Don’t you feel this now in your bereavement, when you look at your children?
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Our death is not an end if we have lived on in our children and the younger generations. For they are us; our bodies are only wilted leaves on the tree of life
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: This life is not such that we ought to complain when it comes to an end for us or for a loved one; rather, we may look back in satisfaction when it has been bravely and honorably withstood
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I am strongly drawn to a frugal life and am often oppressively aware that I am engrossing an undue amount of the labor of my fellow-men
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I am glad that you have given me the opportunity of expressing to you here my deep sense of gratitude as a man, as a good European, and as a Jew
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I believe that whatever we do or live for has its causality; it is good, however, that we cannot see through to it
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: People like you and I, though mortal of course, like everyone else, do not grow old no matter how long we live. What I mean is that we never cease to stand like curious children before the great mystery into which we were born
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I am satisfied with the mystery of the eternity of life and with the awareness and a glimpse of the marvelous structure of the existing world, together with the devoted striving to comprehend a portion, be it ever so tiny, of the Reason that manifest itself in nature
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I am happy at the thought that the worst worries are over for my parents
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: My mother died a week ago today in terrible agony. We are all completely exhausted. One feels in one’s bones the significance of blood ties
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: One of the strongest motives that lead men to art and science is escape from everyday life with its painful crudity and hopeless dreariness, from the fetters of one’s own ever-shifting desires. A finely tempered nature longs to escape from the personal life into the world of objective perception and thought
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: May they not forget to keep pure the great heritage that puts them ahead of the West: the artistic configuration of life, the simplicity and modesty of personal needs, and the purity and serenity of the Japanese soul
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: What depressed me most is, of course, the misfortune of my poor parents who have not had a happy moment for so many years. What further hurts deeply is that as an adult man, I have to look on without being able to do anything
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The satisfaction of physical needs is indeed the indispensable precondition of a satisfactory existence, but in itself it is not enough. In order to be content, men must also have the possibility of developing their intellectual and artistic powers to whatever extent accords with their personal characteristics and abilities
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I just read a wonderful paper by Lenard on the generation of cathode rays by ultraviolet light. Under the influence of this beautiful piece, I am filled with such happiness and joy that I absolutely must share some of it with you
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Human beings can attain a worthy and harmonious life only if they are able to rid themselves, within the limits of human nature, of striving to fulfill wishes of the material kind
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: My mother and sister seem somewhat petty and philistine to me, despite the sympathy I feel for them. It is interesting how gradually our life changes us in the very subtleties of our soul, so that even the closest of family ties dwindle into habitual friendship. Deep inside we no longer understand one another, and are incapable of actively empathizing with the other, or knowing what emotions move the other
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: On his cheerful father: He was content to observe without wishing for more
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: For a place to be born in, the house is pleasant enough, because on that occasion one makes no great aesthetic demands; instead one begins life screaming at one’s dear ones, without bothering too much about reasons and circumstances
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Live with purpose. Don’t let people or things around you get you down
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Death is a reality… Life ends definitely when the subject, by his actions, no longer affects his environment… He can no longer add an iota to the sum total of his experience
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Sometimes the only thought that sustains me and is my only refuge from despair is that I have always done everything I could within my small power, and that year in, year out, I have never permitted myself any amusements or diversions except those afforded by my studies
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving
inspire.author: Albert Einstein
Albert Einstein
inspire.quote: A table, a chair, a bowl of fruit and a violin; what else does a man need to be happy?
On how he sees himself: A person with no roots anywhere…a stranger everywhere
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I am a real lone wolf who has never wholeheartedly belonged to the State, to my country, my circle of friends and not even to my family but who, despite all these bonds, has constantly experienced a feeling of strangeness and the need for solitude
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Be a loner. That gives you time to wonder, to search for the truth. Have holy curiosity. Make your life worth living
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Although I have a regular work schedule, I take time to go for long walks on the beach so that I can listen to what is going on inside my head. If my work isn’t going well, I lie down in the middle of a workday and gaze at the ceiling while I listen and visualize what goes on in my imagination
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I am neither a German citizen, nor do I believe in anything that can be described as a ‘Jewish faith.’ But I am a Jew and glad to belong to the Jewish people, though I do not regard it in any way as chosen
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: My passionate interest in social justice and social responsibility has always stood in curious contrast to a marked lack of desire for direct association with men and women
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I am a horse for single harness, not cut out for tandem or team work. I have never belonged wholeheartedly to country or state, to my circle of friends, or even to my own family. These ties have always been accompanied by a vague aloofness, and the wish to withdraw into myself increases with the years
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: When I was young, all I wanted and expected from life was to sit quietly in some corner doing my work without the public paying attention to me
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: It is strange to be known so universally and yet to be so lonely
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Solitude can be tolerated only up to a certain limit, you know
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: There are two means of refuge from the misery of life – music and cats
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I lived in solitude in the country and noticed how the monotony of a quiet life stimulates the creative mind
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The woman who follows the crowd will usually go no further than the crowd. The woman who walks alone is likely to find herself in places no one has ever been before
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I believe in one thing, that only a life lived for others is a life worth living
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: With fame I become more and more stupid, which of course is a very common phenomenon
inspire.author: Albert Einstein
Albert Einstein
inspire.quote: Why is it that nobody understands me, yet everybody likes me?
Without deep reflection one knows from daily life that one exists for other people
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I simply enjoy giving more than receiving in every respect, to not take myself nor the doings of the masses seriously, am not ashamed of my weaknesses and vices, and naturally take things as they come with equanimity and humor. Many people are like this, and I really cannot understand why I have been made into a kind of idol
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: There is far too great a disproportion between what one is and what others think one is, or at least what they say they think one is. But one has to take it all with good humor
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Of course, understanding of our fellow-beings is important. But this understanding becomes fruitful only when it is sustained by sympathetic feeling in joy and in sorrow. The cultivation of this most important spring of moral action is that which is left of religion when it has been purified of the elements of superstition
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Desire for approval and recognition is a healthy motive, but the desire to be acknowledged as better, stronger or more intelligent than a fellow being or fellow scholar easily leads to an excessively egoistic psychological adjustment
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Many times a day I realize how much my outer and inner life is based upon the labors of my fellow men, both living and dead, and how much I must exert myself in order to give in return as much as I have received
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: It is an irony of fate that I myself have been the recipient of excessive admiration and reverence from my fellow-beings, through no fault or merit of my own
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The best way to cheer yourself is to cheer somebody else up
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The high destiny of the individual is to serve rather than to rule
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The only way to escape the corruptible effect of praise is to go on working
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president of the university
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Look around at how people want to get more out of life than they put in. A man of value will give more than he receives
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I am content in my later years. I have kept my good humor and take neither myself nor the next person seriously
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Without the sense of fellowship with men of like mind, of preoccupation with the objective, the eternally unattainable in the field of art and scientific research, life would have seemed to me empty
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: An awareness of my limitations pervades me all the more keenly in recent times because my faculties have been quite overrated since a few consequences of general relativity theory have stood the test
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: A man’s value to the community depends primarily on how far his feelings, thoughts, and actions are directed towards promoting the good of his fellows
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The most important motive for work in school and in life is pleasure in work, pleasure in its result and the knowledge of the value of the result to the community
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Only one who devotes himself to a cause with his whole strength and soul can be a true master. For this reason mastery demands all of a person
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I lack any sentiment of the sort; all I have is a sense of duty toward all people and an attachment to those with whom I have become intimate
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The world is a dangerous place to live, not because of the people who are evil, but because of the people who don’t do anything about it
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: A man’s ethical behavior should be based effectually on sympathy, education, and social ties; no religious basis is necessary. Man would indeed be in a poor way if he had to be restrained by fear of punishment and hope of reward after death
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Each of us visits this Earth involuntarily, and without an invitation. For me, it is enough to wonder at the secrets
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Be creative, but make sure that what you create is not a curse for mankind
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Love brings much happiness, much more than pining brings pain
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I firmly believe that love [of a subject or hobby] is a better teacher than a sense of duty – at least for me
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Women marry men hoping they will change. Men marry women hoping they will not. So each is inevitably disappointed
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: To Mileva Maric: Only the though of you gives my life here a true meaning
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: To Mileva Maric: How proud I will be to have a little Ph.D. for a sweetheart
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: To Mileva Maric: When you are my dear little wife, we will zealously do scientific work together, so as not to become old philistines, right? My sister seemed to me so philistine. You must never become like that, it would be awful for me. You must always remain my witch and my street urchin?
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: To Mileva Maric: Just be of good cheer, love, and don’t fret
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: To Mileva Maric: If only I could give you some of my happiness, so that you would never be sad and wistful
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: To Mileva Maric: Don’t be angry for my not having written you for so long, I simply haven’t much to say that you don’t know already. So I help myself out with what always stays lovely and nice
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: To Mileva Maric: I am fond of you, my dear girl, and am looking forward to seeing you again on Sunday. We shall again spend an enchanting cozy day together
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: To Mileva Maric: I am so lucky to have found you – a creature who is my equal, and who is as strong and independent as I am
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: To Mileva Maric: Destiny seems to bear some grudge against the two of us. But this will make things all the more beautiful later on, when all obstacles and worries have been overcome
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: To Mileva Maric: But all that doesn’t matter. After all, I have you and your love
inspire.author: Albert Einstein
Albert Einstein
inspire.quote: To Mileva Maric: How delightful it was the last time, when I was allowed to press your dear little person to me the way nature created it, let me tenderly kiss you for that, you dear good soul!

inspire.author: Albert Einstein
inspire.quote: Letter to Marie Winteler: As to whether I will be patient? What other choice do I have with my beloved, naughty little angle?
Letter to Marie Winteler: You mean more to my soul than the whole world did before, the ‘insignificant silly sweetheart that knows nothing and understands nothing’
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Possessing you makes me proud & your love makes me happy. I will be doubly happy when I can press you to my heart again and see your loving eyes
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: When you trip over love, it is easy to get up. But when you fall in love, it is impossible to stand again
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Is it not a lack of real affection that scares me away again and again from marriage. Is it a fear of the comfortable life, or nice furniture, of dishonor that I burden myself with, or even the fear of becoming a contented bourgeois?
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Marriage makes people treat each other as articles of property and no longer as free human beings
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Marriage is but slavery made to appear civilized
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: One must take what nature gives as one finds it
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Joy in looking and comprehending is nature’s most beautiful gift
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: How wretchedly inadequate is the theoretical physicist as he stands before Nature, and before his students
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: My scientific work is motivated by an irresistible longing to understand the secrets of nature and by no other feelings. My love for justice and the striving to contribute towards the improvement of human conditions are quite independent from my scientific interests
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The only reason for time is so that everything doesn’t happen at once
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: (On if his life was a success): Neither on my deathbed nor before will I ask myself such a question. Nature is not an engineer or a contractor, and I myself am a part of Nature
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Occurrences in this domain are beyond the reach of exact prediction because of the variety of factors in operation, not because of any lack of order in nature
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Numerous are the wares that nature produces by the dozen, but her choice products are few
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Space by itself, and time by itself, are doomed to fade away into mere shadows, and only a kind union of the two will preserve an independent reality
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: A spirit is manifest in the laws of the universe, a spirit vastly superior to that of man, and one in the face of which we with our modest powers must feel humble
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: If the bee disappeared off the surface of the globe, then man would have only four years of life left. No more bees, no more pollination, no more plants, no more animals, no more man (See Quote Investigator for the source)
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I sometimes ask myself how it came about that I was the one to develop the theory of relativity. The reason, I think, is that a normal adult never stops to think about problems of space and time. These are things which he has thought about as a child
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: What I see is a certain something, desolate and grey as infinity. I do not believe that the structure of the human brain is to be blamed for the fact that man cannot grasp infinity
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Make a lot of walks to get healthy and don’t read that much but save yourself some until you’re grown up
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: A human being is a part of a whole, called by us ‘universe’, a part limited in time and space. He experiences himself, his thoughts and feelings as something separated from the rest… a kind of optical delusion of his consciousness. This delusion is a kind of prison for us, restricting us to our personal desires and to affection for a few persons nearest to us. Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Failure and deprivation are the best educators and purifiers
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I do not much believe in education. Each man ought to be his own model, however frightful that may be
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The only thing that you absolutely have to know, is the location of the library
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Combinatory play seems to be the essential feature in productive thought
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: That is the way to learn the most, that when you are doing something with such enjoyment that you don’t notice that the time passes
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: On education: The point is to develop the childlike inclination for play and the childlike desire for recognition and to guide the child over to important fields for society; it is that education which in the main is founded upon the desire for successful activity and acknowledgment
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The aim (of education) must be the training of independently acting and thinking individuals who, however, can see in the service to the community their highest life achievement
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Studying, and striving for truth and beauty in general, is a sphere in which we are allowed to be children throughout life
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Only if outward and inner freedom are constantly and consciously pursued is there a possibility of spiritual development and perfection and thus of improving man’s outward and inner life
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Never regard your study as a duty, but as the enviable opportunity to learn the liberating beauty of the intellect for your own personal joy and for the profit of the community to which your later work will belong
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Schools may favor such freedom by encouraging independent thought
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I believe, indeed, that overemphasis on the purely intellectual attitude, often directed solely to the practical and factual, in our education, has led directly to the impairment of ethical values
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Today also there is an urge toward social progress, toward tolerance and freedom of thought, toward a larger political unity… But the students at our universities have ceased as completely as their teachers to embody the hopes and ideals of the people
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The most valuable thing a teacher can impart to children is not knowledge and understanding per se but a longing for knowledge and understanding, and an appreciation for intellectual values, whether they be artistic, scientific, or moral
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: It is true that my parents were worried because I began to speak relatively late, so much so that they consulted a doctor. I can’t say how old I was then, certainly not less than three
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: In the matter of physics [education], the first lessons should contain nothing but what is experimental and interesting to see
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: When I was a little boy my father showed me a small compass, and the enormous impression that it made on me certainly played a role in my life
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: (Part 1) It is not so very important for a person to learn facts. For that he does not really need college. He can learn them from books
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: (Part 2) The value of an education in a liberal arts college is not the learning of many facts, but the training of the mind to think something that cannot be learned from textbooks
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Copernicus, through his work and the greatness of his personality, taught man to be modest.
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Young people especially like to contemplate bold projects. Also, it is natural for a serious young man to envision his desired goals with the greatest possible precision
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Reading, after a certain age, diverts the mind too much from its creative pursuits. Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: We will hope that future historians will explain the morbid symptoms of present day society as the childhood ailments of an aspiring humanity, due entirely to the excessive speed at which civilization was advancing
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The students at our universities have ceased as completely as their teachers to enshrine the hopes and ideals of the nation
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Numerous are the academic chairs, but rare are wise and noble teachers. Numerous and large are the lecture halls, but far from numerous the young people who genuinely thirst for truth and justice
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: When compared to six years’ schooling at a German authoritarian gymnasium, it made me clearly realize how much superior an education based on free action and personal responsibility is to one relying on outward authority
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: This is quite natural: everybody likes to do that for which he has a talent
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: If you can’t explain it to a six year old, you don’t understand it yourself
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: This delicate little plant [curiosity], aside from stimulation, stands mainly in need of freedom
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I never made one of my discoveries through the process of rational thinking
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: True art is characterized by an irresistible urge in the creative artist
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: It is a miracle that curiosity survives formal education
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The gift of fantasy has meant more to me than my talent for absorbing positive knowledge
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I very rarely think in words at all. A thought comes, and I may try to express it in words afterwards
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I am certain that it is the mystery of not understanding that attracts people; it impresses them with the aura and magnetism of mystery
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The great moral teachers of humanity were, in a way, artistic geniuses in the art of living
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: There is no logical way to the discovery of these elemental laws. There is only the way of intuition, which is helped by a feeling for the order lying behind the appearance
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The more a man is imbued with the ordered regularity of all events the firmer becomes his convictions that there is no room left by the side of this ordered regularity for cause of a different nature
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The development of science and of the creative activities of the spirit in general requires still another kind of freedom, which may be characterized as inward freedom. It is this freedom of the spirit which consists in the independence of thought from the restrictions of authoritarian and social prejudices as well as from unphilosophical routinizing and habit in general
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing. One cannot help but be in awe when one contemplates the mysteries of eternity, of life, of the marvelous structure of reality. It is enough if one tries to comprehend only a little of this mystery every day
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: People like you and me never grow old. We never cease to stand like curious children before the great mystery into which we were born
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The secret to creativity is knowing how to hide your sources
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Music doesn’t influence research work, but both are nourished by the same sort of longing, and they complement each other in the satisfaction they offer
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: As to Schubert, I have only this to say: play the music, love – and keep you mouth shut
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: This is what I have to say about Bach’s life and work: listen, play, love, revere – and keep your mouth shut
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Mozart’s music is so pure and beautiful that I see it as a reflection of the inner beauty of the universe
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I took violin lessons from age 6 to 14, but had no luck with my teachers, for whom music did not transcend mechanical practicing, I really began to learn only when I was about 13 years old, mainly after I had fallen in love with Mozart’s sonatas
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Without creative personalities able to think and judge independently, the upward development of society is as unthinkable as the development of the individual personality without the nourishing soil of the community
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: A big fat book full of colored drawings by Japanese children lies always on my table
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: A country becomes really a soul only in consciously serving the intellectual life
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The theme that I recognize in Galileo’s work, is the passionate fight against any kind of dogma based on authority
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Suspicion against every kind of authority grew out of this experience, an attitude which has never again left me
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Everything that is really great and inspiring is created by the individual who can labor in freedom
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Setting an example is not the main means of influencing another, it is the only means
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Success comes from curiosity, concentration, perseverance and self-criticism
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The ordinary objects of human endeavour – property, outward success, luxury – have always seemed to me contemptible
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Most people stop looking when they find the proverbial needle in the haystack. I would continue looking to see if there were other needles
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The example of great and pure individuals in the only thing that can lead us to noble thoughts and deeds
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: If you want to live a happy life, tie it to a goal, not to people or things
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Few are those who see with their own eyes and feel with their own hearts
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: If the rabble continues to occupy itself with you, then simply don’t read that hogwash, but rather leave it to the reptile for whom it has been fabricated (Letter to Marie Curie about critics)
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I think and think for months and years. Ninety-nine times, the conclusion is false. The hundredth time I am right
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I most seriously believe that one does people the best service by giving them some elevating work to do and thus indirectly elevating them
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The attempt to combine wisdom and power has only rarely been successful and then only for a short while
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The true value of a human being is determined primarily by the measure and the sense in which he has attained liberation from the self
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: On Mahatma Gandhi after his assassination: Generations to come, it may well be, will scarce believe that such a man as this one ever in flesh and blood walked upon this Earth
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Few people are capable of expressing with equanimity opinions which differ from the prejudices of their social environment. Most people are even incapable of forming such opinions
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: A man should look for what is, and not for what he thinks should be
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: To make a goal of comfort or happiness has never appealed to me; a system of ethics built on this basis would be sufficient only for a herd of cattle
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Scientists investigate that which already is
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I am not very satisfied with my theory of thermoelectricity
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I never failed in mathematics. Before I was fifteen I had mastered differential and integral calculus
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The whole of science is nothing more than a refinement of everyday thinking
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: It is the theory that decides what can be observed
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Everyone who is seriously involved in the pursuit of science becomes convinced that some spirit is manifest in the laws of the universe, one that is vastly superior to that of man. In this way the pursuit of science leads to a religious feeling of a special sort, which is surely quite different from the religiosity of someone more naive
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The scientist find his rewards in what Henri Poincaré calls the joy of comprehension, and not in the possibilities of application to which any discovery may lead
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: To his sons: I am actually glad that neither of you dedicated yourselves to science, because it is a hard thing, full of difficult and futile work
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: This world is a strange madhouse. Currently, every coachman and every waiter is debating whether relativity theory is correct
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: When I have no special problem to occupy my mind, I love to reconstruct proofs of mathematical and physical theorems that have long been known to me. There is no goal in this, merely an opportunity to indulge in the pleasant occupation of thinking
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The real goal of my research has always been the simplification and unification of the system of theoretical physics
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The progress of science presupposes the possibility of unrestricted communications of all results and judgments – freedom of expression and instruction in all realms of intellectual endeavor
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: This evening I sat 2 hours at the window and thought about how the law of interaction of molecular forces could be determined
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The process of scientific discovery is, in effect, a continual flight from wonder
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: People like us, who believe in physics, know that the distinction between past, present, and future is only a stubbornly persistent illusion
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The grand aim of all science is to cover the greatest number of empirical facts by logical deduction from the smallest number of hypotheses or axioms
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Why does this magnificent applied science which saves work and makes life easier bring us so little happiness? The simple answer runs: Because we have not yet learned to make sensible use of it
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: In science, moreover, the work of the individual is so bound up with that of his scientific predecessors and contemporaries that it appears almost as an impersonal product of his generation
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: It has become appallingly obvious that our technology has exceeded our humanity
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Our entire much-praised technological progress, and civilization generally, could be compared to an axe in the hand of a pathological criminal
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Concern for man and his fate must always form the chief objective of all technological endeavors… in order that the creations of our minds shall be a blessing and not a curse to mankind. Never forget this in the midst of your diagrams and equations
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Yes, we have to divide up our time like that, between our politics and our equations. But to me our equations are far more important, for politics are only a matter of present concern. A mathematical equation stands forever
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I assert that the cosmic religious experience is the strongest and the noblest driving force behind scientific research
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Equations are more important to me, because politics is for the present, but an equation is something for eternity
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Pure mathematics is, in its way, the poetry of logical ideas
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I am a deeply religious nonbeliever. This is a somewhat new kind of religion
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Before God we are all equally wise – and equally foolish
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: A religious person is devout in the sense that he has no doubt about the significance of those superpersonal objects and goals which neither require nor are capable of rational foundation
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: What really interests me is whether God had any choice in the creation of the world
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The further the spiritual evolution of mankind advances, the more certain it seems to me that the path to genuine religiosity does not lie through the fear of life, and the fear of death, and blind faith, but through striving after rational knowledge
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: True religion is real living; living with all one’s soul, with all one’s goodness and righteousness
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: My religion consists of a humble admiration of the illimitable superior spirit who reveals himself in the slight details we are able to perceive with our frail and feeble mind
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: My religiosity consists in a humble admiration of the infinitely superior spirit that reveals itself in the little that we, with our weak and transitory understanding, can comprehend of reality
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Through the reading of popular scientific books, I soon reached the conviction that much in the stories of the Bible could not be true. The consequence was a positively fanatic orgy of freethinking coupled with the impression that youth is intentionally being deceived by the state through lies; it was a crushing impression
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Though I am now an old fogey, I am still hard at work and still refuse to believe that God plays dice
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Strenuous intellectual work and looking at God’s nature are the reconciling, fortifying, yet relentlessly strict angels that shall lead me through all of life’s troubles
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: God does not care about our mathematical difficulties. He integrates empirically
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: We should take care not to make the intellect our God; it has, of course, powerful muscles, but no personality
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I believe in Spinoza’s God, Who reveals Himself in the lawful harmony of the world, not in a God Who concerns Himself with the fate and the doings of mankind
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Try and penetrate with our limited means the secrets of nature and you will find that, behind all the discernible concatenations, there remains something subtle, intangible and inexplicable. Veneration for this force beyond anything that we can comprehend is my religion. To that extent I am, in point of fact, religious
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: That deep emotional conviction of the presence of a superior reasoning power, which is revealed in the incomprehensible universe, forms my idea of God
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I cannot imagine a God who rewards and punishes the objects of his creation and is but a reflection of human frailty
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: All religions, arts and sciences are branches of the same tree
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Whoever undertakes to set himself up as a judge of Truth and Knowledge is shipwrecked by the laughter of the gods
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: God gave me the stubbornness of a mule and a fairly keen scent
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Peace cannot be kept by force. It can only be achieved by understanding
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Only through perils and upheavals can Nations be brought to further developments. May the present upheavals lead to a better world
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I made one great mistake in my life, when I signed the letter to Franklin D. Roosevelt recommending that atom bombs be made
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: My pacifism is not based on any intellectual theory but on a deep antipathy to every form of cruelty and hatred
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Every man has a right over his own life and war destroys lives that were full of promise
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I am not only a pacifist but a militant pacifist. I am willing to fight for peace. Nothing will end war unless the people themselves refuse to go to war
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The goal of pacifism is possible only though a supranational organization. To stand unconditionally for this cause is the criterion of true pacifism
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: We must begin to inculcate our children against militarism by educating them in the spirit of pacifism. Our schoolbooks glorify war and conceal it’s horror. I would teach peace rather than war
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Today, in twelve countries, young men are resisting conscription and refusing military service. They are the pioneers of a warless world
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: He who joyfully marches to music in rank and file has already earned my contempt. He has been given a large brain by mistake, since for him the spinal cord would suffice
inspire.author: Albert Einstein
Albert Einstein
inspire.quote: Heroism on command, senseless violence, and all the loathsome nonsense that goes by the name of patriotism – how passionately I hate them!
I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: There will be no peace on earth, the wounds inflicted by the war will not heal, until this internationalism is restored
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The release of atomic energy has not created a new problem. It has merely made more urgent the necessity of solving an existing one
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The release of atom power has changed everything except our way of thinking… the solution to this problem lies in the heart of mankind. If only I had known, I should have become a watchmaker
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I appeal to all men and women, whether they be eminent or humble, to declare that they will refuse to give any further assistance to war or the preparation of war
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I am not only a pacifist, but a militant pacifist. I am willing to fight for peace… Is it not better for a man to die for a cause in which he believes, such as peace, than to suffer for a cause in which he does not believe, such as war?
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Never do anything against conscience, even if the state demands it
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Relativity applies to physics, not ethics
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Nationalism is an infantile disease. It is the measles of mankind
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Laws alone can not secure freedom of expression; in order that every man present his views without penalty there must be spirit of tolerance in the entire population
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The most important human endeavor is the striving for morality in our actions. Our inner balance and even our very existence depend on it. Only morality in our actions can give beauty and dignity to life
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: One must shy away from questionable undertakings, even when they bear a high-sounding name
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Without ‘ethical culture’ there is no salvation for humanity
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Fulfillment on the moral and esthetic side is a goal which lies closer to the preoccupations of art than it does to those of science
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: In two weeks the sheeplike masses of any country can be worked up by the newspaper into such a state of excited fury that men are prepared to put on uniforms and kill and be killed, for the sake of the sordid ends of a few interested parties
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: In politics not only are leaders lacking, but the independence of spirit and the sense of justice of the citizen have to a great extent declined
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The cult of individuals is always, in my view, unjustified
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: An empty stomach is not a good political adviser
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Ethical axioms are found and tested not very differently from the axioms of science. Truth is what stands the test of experience
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Force always attracts men of low morality, and I believe it to be an invariable rule that tyrants of genius are succeeded by scoundrels
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Nothing is more destructive of respect for the government and the law of the land than passing laws which cannot be enforced
inspire.author: Albert Einstein
Albert Einstein
inspire.quote: I wouldn’t have thought it possible that there could exist such heartless and outright wicked people!?
I believe that we have to content ourselves with our imperfect knowledge and understanding and treat values and moral obligations as a purely human problem, the most important of all human problems
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: It is the duty of every citizen according to his best capacities to give validity to his convictions in political affairs
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Everyone is aware of the difficult and menacing situation in which human society, shrunk into one community with a common fate, finds itself, but only a few act accordingly
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I do not believe that civilization will be wiped out in a war fought with the atomic bomb. Perhaps two-thirds of the people of the earth will be killed
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Everyone should be respected as an individual, but no one idolized
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Morality is of the highest importance – but for us, not for God
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Intellectual growth should commence at birth and cease only at death
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: We will not change the hearts of other men by mechanisms, but by changing our hearts and speaking bravely… When we are clear in heart and mind – only then – shall we find courage to surmount the fear which haunts the world
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: All that is valuable in human society depends upon the opportunity for development accorded the individual
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: A photograph never grows old. You and I change, people change all through the months and years but a photograph always remains the same. How nice to look at a photograph of mother or father taken many years ago. You see them as you remember them. But as people live on, they change completely. That is why I think a photograph can be kind
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Nothing will benefit human health and increase chances of survival for life on earth as much as the evolution to a vegetarian diet
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: It is my view that the vegetarian manner of living by its purely physical effect on the human temperament would most beneficially influence the lot of mankind
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Innovation is not the product of logical thought, although the result is tied to logical structure
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Thinking is hard work; that’s why so few do it
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: I must be willing to give up what I am in order to become what I will be
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Whenever he felt that he had come to the end of the road or faced a difficult challenge in his work, he would take refuge in music and that would solve all his difficulties
inspire.author: Hans Einstein (Albert’s sons)

inspire.quote: In building a theory, his approach had something in common with that of an artist. He would aim for simplicity and beauty, and beauty for him was, after all, essentially simplicity
inspire.author: Nathan Rosen

inspire.quote: He could be downright brutal, but he could show deep compassion for the poor, weak, and persecuted. He alternated between kind sage and incorrigible mule, an egocentric loner with a sense of responsibility for all of mankind
inspire.author: Jurgen Neffe (link to the Amazon author page)

inspire.quote: Very few were able to grasp his thoughts and fully appreciate the heroic fruits of his years of labor to create a new cosmic order
inspire.author: Jurgen Neffe

inspire.quote: His quest yearning for harmony and his crusade against any form of authority extended to humankind as a whole, and to the process of cultural progress
inspire.author: Jurgen Neffe

inspire.quote: Albert preferred being alone, according to his sister, and he immersed himself for hours in activities that required patience and stamina
inspire.author: Jurgen Neffe

inspire.quote: Unlike most of his schoolmates, and schoolchildren today for that matter, the young Albert supplemented his education at school with his own self-styled curriculum at home and developed the skills he deemed important. He read and read and read. When he was hard at work, even the chaos of the family’s constant chatter could not distract the little autodidact
inspire.author: Jurgen Neffe

inspire.quote: While the other children his age pursued adventures outdoors, he sough his flow experience in his head. […] Einstein craved his rewards through the continued satisfaction on his unquenchable thirst for knowledge
inspire.author: Jurgen Neffe

inspire.quote: He rebelled against any kind of authoritarian structure: against rigid rules in school and at the university; against the dictates of bourgeois life; against conventions such as dress codes; against dogmatism in religion and physics; against militarism, nationalism, and government ideology; and against bosses and employers. His opposition to all forms of opportunism was one of the most remarkable of his personality traits
inspire.author: Jurgen Neffe

inspire.quote: Innumerable reports attest to Einstein’s playfulness, his wonderful rapport with children, his lighthearted wit, and his delight in practical jokes. In the spring of 2003, Simon Baron-Cohen of Cambridge University, one of the leading researchers on autism, touched off a media sensation by claiming that Einstein may have been autistic
inspire.author: Jurgen Neffe

inspire.quote: He sought to find laws of nature that epitomized his ideal of science, a complete, unified description of the world
inspire.author: Jurgen Neffe

inspire.quote: He simply cared far more than most of his colleagues that the laws of physics have to explain everything in nature coherently and consistently
inspire.author: Lee Smolin

inspire.quote: The point is that the arts are important enough to have influenced the greatest minds and talents we know. Albert Einstein said that if he were not a physicist, he would probably be a musician
inspire.author: Mickey Hart

inspire.quote: On how he relaxes after work playing his violin: First I improvise, and if that doesn’t help, I seek solace in Mozart. But when I am improvising and it appears that something may come of it, I require the clear constructions of Bach in order to follow through
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: His cocky contempt for authority led him to question received wisdom in ways that well-trained acolytes in the academy never contemplated
inspire.author: Walter Isaacson (link to the book Einstein: His Life and Universe)

inspire.quote: Persistence and tenacity were obviously already part of his character
inspire.author: Maja Einstein (Albert’s sister)

inspire.quote: From his youth, Einstein had a habit of spending a lot of time away from his friends, family, and work, to do nothing but think
inspire.author: Mayo Oshin

inspire.quote: He would regularly go for long walks, wander off to quiet cabins in the mountains, play his violin, or sail the seas with his wooden boat to find serenity
inspire.author: Mayo Oshin

inspire.quote: He liked to work on puzzles, erect complex structures with his toy building set, play with a steam engine that his uncle gave him, and build houses of cards
inspire.author: Walter Isaacson

inspire.quote: Throughout his life, Albert Einstein would retain the intuition and the awe of a child. He never lost his sense of wonder at the magic of nature’s phenomena
inspire.author: Walter Isaacson

inspire.quote: He was that odd breed, a reverential rebel, and he was guided by a faith, which he wore lightly and with a twinkle in his eye, in a God who would not play dice by allowing things to happen by chance
inspire.author: Walter Isaacson

inspire.quote: You are the only sort of man in whose existence I see much hope for in this deplorable world
inspire.author: George Bernard Shaw

inspire.quote: He simplified his concerns in order to spend his time wisely… This same uncluttered attitude allowed him to speak directly, with unaffected kindness and respect, to every human being he met, child or adult, ignoring externals
inspire.author: Alan Richards

inspire.quote: To me, he appears as out of comparison the greatest intellect of this century, and almost certainly the greatest personification of moral experience. He was in many ways different from the rest of the species. C.P
inspire.author: Snow

inspire.quote: No other man contributed so much to the vast expansion of 20th century knowledge. Yet no other man was more modest in the possession of the power that is knowledge, more sure that power without wisdom is deadly. Dwight D
inspire.author: Eisenhower

inspire.quote: When Einstein stuck out his tongue, at the world and the future, late in his life, he provided us with the image that signaled his complete transformation from a man to a metaphor. A breaker of taboos, part Galileo and part Gandhi, he succeeded in synthesizing artistic freedom with philosophical power
inspire.author: Jurgen Neffe

inspire.quote: Nothing, indeed, could turn him away from the sole aim of his being, in the service of which was accumulated all the immortal fire within his nature, all that was great and vital in his spirit
inspire.author: Max Brod

inspire.quote: He expended his whole personality, heart and head alike, upon his scientific labors. Nothing was left over for human intercourse but a peevish insignificant little shadow of himself
inspire.author: Max Brod

inspire.quote: Time and time again Einstein filled me with amazement, and indeed enthusiasm, as I watched the ease with which he would, in discussion, experimentally change his point of view, at times tentatively adopting the opposite view and viewing the whole problem from a new and totally changed angle
inspire.author: Max Brod

inspire.quote: He was a loner with an intimate bond to humanity, a rebel who was suffused with reverence
inspire.author: Walter Isaacson

inspire.quote: There is the odd exception, like Albert Einstein, but as a breed, scientists tend not be very good at presenting themselves
inspire.author: Bill Bryson

inspire.quote: In matters of logic and contemplation, Einstein understood everyone quite well, but he had a much harder time grasping emotional issues. It was difficult for him to imagine impulses and feelings unrelated to his own life
inspire.author: Leopold Infeld

inspire.quote: He had such difficulty with language that those around him feared he would never learn
inspire.author: Maja Einstein (Albert’s sister)

inspire.quote: I always love to quote Albert Einstein because nobody dares contradict him
inspire.author: Studs Terkel

inspire.quote: Once, when a company had sent him a very sizable consulting fee, he used the check for a bookmark, then lost the book
inspire.author: Alan Richards

inspire.quote: A healthy body means a healthy mind. You get your heart rate up, and you get the blood flowing through your body to your brain. Look at Albert Einstein. He rode a bicycle. He was also an early student of Jazzercise. You never saw Einstein lift his shirt, but he had a six-pack under there
inspire.author: Steve Carell

inspire.quote: Silly, overly truthful and helpless child
inspire.author: Maja Einstein (Albert’s sister on how she called her brother)

inspire.quote: His inner security was tempered by the humility that comes from being awed by nature
inspire.author: Walter Isaacson

inspire.quote: Quantum Mechanics and General Relativity are both accepted as scientific fact even though they’re mutually exclusive. Albert Einstein spent the second half of his life searching for a unifying truth that would reconcile the two. Roy H
inspire.author: Williams

inspire.quote: Even though he was still priding himself on being a vagabond and a loner, he began to hand around the coffee-houses and attend musical soirees with a congenial crowd of bohemian soul mates and fellow students
inspire.author: Walter Isaacson

inspire.quote: He regarded a world authority as realistic rather than idealistic, as practical rather than naïve
inspire.author: Walter Isaacson

inspire.quote: I’m like a run-down old car – something is wrong in every corner. But life is still worthwhile as long as I can still work
inspire.author: January 9, 1955 (Death on April 18, 1955)

inspire.quote: I have finished my task here
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: We dance for laughter, we dance for tears, we dance for madness, we dance for fears, we dance for hopes, we dance for screams, we are the dancers, we create the dreams
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Whatever happens, take responsibility
inspire.author: Tony Robbins

inspire.quote: Never whine, never complain, never try to justify yourself
inspire.author: Robert Greene

inspire.quote: If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door
inspire.author: Milton Berle

inspire.quote: If you don’t like something, change it. If you can’t change it, change your attitude
inspire.author: Maya Angelou

inspire.quote: It is good people who make good places
inspire.author: Anna Sewell

inspire.quote: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars
inspire.author: Oscar Wilde

inspire.quote: Sooner or later, those who win are those who think they can
inspire.author: Richard Bach

inspire.quote: Nurture your mind with great thoughts, for you will never go any higher than you think
inspire.author: Benjamin Disraeli

inspire.quote: Weakness of attitude becomes weakness of character
inspire.author: Albert Einstein

inspire.quote: Keep your thoughts positive because your thoughts become your words. Keep your words positive because your words become your behavior. Keep your behavior positive because your behavior becomes your habits. Keep your habits positive because your habits become your values. Keep your values positive because your values become your destiny
inspire.author: Mahatma Gandhi

inspire.quote: Men do not attract that which they want, but that which they are
inspire.author: James Allen

inspire.quote: The weak make others feel inferior. The strong make others feel equal
inspire.author: Maxime Lagacé

inspire.quote: A quick temper will make a fool of you soon enough
inspire.author: Bruce Lee

inspire.quote: What they call you is one thing. What you answer to is something else
inspire.author: Lucille Clifton

inspire.quote: It’s not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters
inspire.author: Epictetus

inspire.quote: A man sees in the world what he carries in his heart
inspire.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

inspire.quote: Your problem isn’t the problem, it’s your attitude about the problem
inspire.author: Ann Brashares

inspire.quote: Excellence is not a skill. It is an attitude
inspire.author: Ralph Marston

inspire.quote: To put the world right in order, we must first put the nation in order; to put the nation in order, we must first put the family in order; to put the family in order, we must first cultivate our personal life; we must first set our hearts right
inspire.author: Confucius

inspire.quote: We lost because we told ourselves we lost
inspire.author: Leo Tolstoy

inspire.quote: Having a positive mental attitude is asking how something can be done rather than saying it can’t be done
inspire.author: Robert Foster Bennett

inspire.quote: Things turn out best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out
inspire.author: John Wooden

inspire.quote: The most effective attitude to adopt is one of supreme acceptance
inspire.author: Robert Greene

inspire.quote: Action springs not from thought, but from a readiness for responsibility
inspire.author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

inspire.quote: The meaning of things lies not in the things themselves, but in our attitude towards them
inspire.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

inspire.quote: You really can change the world if you care enough
inspire.author: Marian Wright Edelman

inspire.quote: I am not a product of my circumstances. I am a product of my decisions
inspire.author: Stephen Covey

inspire.quote: A discriminating irreverence is the creator and protector of human liberty
inspire.author: Mark Twain

inspire.quote: The most important decision you make is to be in a good mood
inspire.author: Voltaire

inspire.quote: People only see what they are prepared to see
inspire.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

inspire.quote: What others think of me is none of my business
inspire.author: Unknown (Submitted by the Wisdom Quotes Community)

inspire.quote: In the depth of winter I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer
inspire.author: Albert Camus

inspire.quote: I don’t like that man. I must get to know him better
inspire.author: Abraham Lincoln

inspire.quote: When you can’t change the direction of the wind — adjust your sails. H
inspire.author: Jackson Brown Jr

inspire.quote: Your living is determined not so much by what life brings to you as by the attitude you bring to life; not so much by what happens to you as by the way your mind looks at what happens
inspire.author: Kahlil Gibran

inspire.quote: Two things define you: your patience when you have nothing and your attitude when you have everything
inspire.author: George Bernard Shaw

inspire.quote: No one will hit you harder than life itself. It doesn’t matter how hard you hit back. It’s about how much you can take, and keep fighting, how much you can suffer and keep moving forward. That’s how you win
inspire.author: Sylvester Stallone

inspire.quote: An optimist is the human personification of spring. Susan J
inspire.author: Bissonette

inspire.quote: You cannot have a positive life and a negative mind
inspire.author: Joyce Meyer

inspire.quote: Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference
inspire.author: Winston Churchill

inspire.quote: Attitudes are nothing more than habits of thought. John C
inspire.author: Maxwell

inspire.quote: Attitudes are a secret power working twenty-four hours a day, for good or bad. It is of paramount importance that we know how to harness and control this great force
inspire.author: Irving Berlin

inspire.quote: Attitude is more important than the past, than education, than money, than circumstances, than what people do or say. It is more important than appearance, giftedness, or skill. W. C
inspire.author: Fields

inspire.quote: Attitude is everything, so pick a good one
inspire.author: Wayne Dyer

inspire.quote: Attitude is altitude
inspire.author: Nick Vujicic

inspire.quote: Life is 10% what happens to me and 90% of how I react to it. John C
inspire.author: Maxwell

inspire.quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent
inspire.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

inspire.quote: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude
inspire.author: Oprah Winfrey

inspire.quote: When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us
inspire.author: Helen Keller

inspire.quote: A pessimist is one who makes difficulties of his opportunities and an optimist is one who makes opportunities of his difficulties. Harry S
inspire.author: Truman

inspire.quote: If you are going to achieve excellence in big things, you develop the habit in little matters. Excellence is not an exception, it is a prevailing attitude
inspire.author: Colin Powell

inspire.quote: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it
inspire.author: Henry Ford

inspire.quote: If you think you can, you can. And if you think you can’t, you’re right
inspire.author: Henry Ford

inspire.quote: I’m a great believer in luck and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it
inspire.author: Thomas Jefferson

inspire.quote: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other one thing
inspire.author: Abraham Lincoln

inspire.quote: I’ve developed a new philosophy. I only dread one day at a time
inspire.author: Charlie Brown

inspire.quote: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading
inspire.author: Lao Tzu

inspire.quote: I can’t change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination
inspire.author: Jimmy Dean

inspire.quote: You must be the change you want to see in the world
inspire.author: Mahatma Gandhi

inspire.quote: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work. Thomas A
inspire.author: Edison

inspire.quote: There is nothing either good or bad but thinking makes it so
inspire.author: William Shakespeare

inspire.quote: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow
inspire.author: Helen Keller

inspire.quote: Pessimism never won any battle. Dwight D
inspire.author: Eisenhower

inspire.quote: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude
inspire.author: Zig Ziglar

inspire.quote: Attitudes are more important than facts
inspire.author: George MacDonald

inspire.quote: I will not take "but" for an answer
inspire.author: Langston Hughes

inspire.quote: Your aspirations are your possibilities
inspire.author: Samuel Johnson

inspire.quote: Attitude will always define who we are in life. Mark A
inspire.author: Brennan

inspire.quote: To fly, we have to have resistance
inspire.author: Maya Lin

inspire.quote: Preparation + Attitude + Opportunity + Action = Luck. John C
inspire.author: Maxwell

inspire.quote: Every wall is a door
inspire.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

inspire.quote: A bad attitude is worse than a bad swing
inspire.author: Payne Stewart

inspire.quote: Only you can control your future. Dr
inspire.author: Seuss

inspire.quote: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier
inspire.author: Colin Powell

inspire.quote: Every day brings new choices
inspire.author: Martha Beck

inspire.quote: Responsibility is the great developer of men
inspire.author: Mary Parker Follett

inspire.quote: You become what you think about
inspire.author: Napoleon Hill

inspire.quote: If you think you can’t, you’re right
inspire.author: Carol Bartz

inspire.quote: Attitude determines the altitude of life
inspire.author: Edwin Louis Cole

inspire.quote: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me
inspire.author: Carol Burnett

inspire.quote: I don’t get lucky. I make my own luck
inspire.author: Harvey Specter (Suits)

inspire.quote: Strength and growth come only through continuous effort and struggle
inspire.author: Napoleon Hill

inspire.quote: If you own this story you get to write the ending
inspire.author: Brené Brown

inspire.quote: You cannot dream yourself into a character; you must hammer and forge yourself one. James A
inspire.author: Froude

inspire.quote: Take the attitude of a student, never be too big to ask questions, never know too much to learn something new
inspire.author: Og Mandino

inspire.quote: The greatest revolution of our generation is the discovery that human beings, by changing the inner attitudes of their minds, can change the outer aspects of their lives
inspire.author: William James

inspire.quote: Put yourself in a state of mind where you say to yourself, "Here is an opportunity for me to celebrate like never before, my own power, my own ability to get myself to do whatever is necessary"
inspire.author: Unknown

inspire.quote: The quickest way to change your attitude toward pain is to accept the fact that everything that happens to us has been designed for our spiritual growth. M
inspire.author: Scott Peck

inspire.quote: And as we let our own light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same. As we are liberated from our fear, our presence automatically liberates others
inspire.author: Marianne Williamson

inspire.quote: The world belongs to those who set out to conquer it armed with self-confidence and good humour
inspire.author: Charles Dickens (See also: confidence quotes)

inspire.quote: The truth is that our finest moments are most likely to occur when we are feeling deeply uncomfortable, unhappy, or unfulfilled. For it is only in such moments, propelled by our discomfort, that we are likely to step out of our ruts and start searching for different ways or truer answers. M
inspire.author: Scott Peck

inspire.quote: Then, without realizing it, you try to improve yourself at the start of each new day; of course, you achieve quite a lot in the course of time. Anyone can do this, it costs nothing and is certainly very helpful. Whoever doesn’t know it must learn and find by experience that a quiet conscience makes one strong
inspire.author: Anne Frank

inspire.quote: Build your own dreams, or someone else will hire you to build theirs
inspire.author: Farrah Gray

inspire.quote: The price of greatness is responsibility
inspire.author: Winston Churchill

inspire.quote: When you’re backed against the wall, break the goddamn thing down
inspire.author: Harvey Specter (Suits)

inspire.quote: Bite off more than you can chew, then chew it
inspire.author: Ella Williams

inspire.quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world
inspire.author: Norman Vincent Peale

inspire.quote: Small opportunities are often the beginning of great enterprises
inspire.author: Demosthenes

inspire.quote: I don’t think of all the misery but of the beauty that still remains
inspire.author: Anne Frank

inspire.quote: People who say it cannot be done should not interrupt those who are doing it
inspire.author: George Bernard Shaw

inspire.quote: Eagles come in all shapes and sizes, but you will recognize them chiefly by their attitudes. E. F
inspire.author: Schumacher
